text:
• これは、正式名称を「視覚障害者誘導用ブロック」と言い、歩道・駅・公共施設の
入口など、多くの人が利用する場所に設置されています
– ここでＭさんは、見えていないはずなのに、辺りを見回しています
– そしてしばらく、じっと待った後、自分の前を、誰かが左から右の方へ
通り過ぎたのを察知したのか、「すみません」と声を掛けました
• 声を掛けられた男性は一旦立ち止まりますが、何のことか分からなかったのか、
trans:
•This is officially called a "guidance block for visually impaired people" and is installed
in places frequently used by many, such as sidewalks, train stations, and public facility entrances.
– Here, Ms. M, despite presumably not being able to see, looks around the area.
– Then, after waiting quietly for a while,
–she seems to notice someone passing in front of her from left to right and calls out, "Excuse me."
•The man who was called out stops momentarily but, perhaps not understanding what it was about, ...
